metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2118 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The MS-SAMR and MS-LSAD protocol implementations in Samba 3.x and 4.xbefore 4.2.11, 4.3.x before 4.3.8, and 4.4.x before 4.4.2 mishandle DCERPCconnections, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to performprotocol-downgrade attacks and impersonate users by modifying theclient-server data stream, aka "BADLOCK."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2118` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
python-samba - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1').
